H0.text: The earth is divided into the crust, mantle, and core.

H1.text: Crust, core, magma are the three parts into which the earth is divided.

H2.text: Oceans, land, and air are the three parts into which the earth is divided.

H3.text: Troposphere, atomosphere, and xerosphere are the three parts into which Earth is divided.

A4.text: The internal structure of Earth is the spatial variation of chemical and physical properties in the solid earth. The primary structure is a series of layers: an outer silicate crust, a mechanically weak asthenosphere, a solid mantle, a liquid outer core whose flow generates the Earth's magnetic field, and a solid inner core.

A5.text: Earth's crust ranges from 5 to 70 kilometres... The mantle is divided into upper and lower mantle... The core is divided into outer and inner core.
